Job Description: Broadcom's Central Engineering Design Correlation team is looking for an energetic and self-driven professional to join our team to help with silicon technology evaluation in advanced process nodes for IP and product designs. Our mission is to assess foundry technology offerings, help define new technology platform for IP and product designs, risk assessment, and provide Broadcom’s design communities with insights into design and process-technology interactions especially during co-development in advanced process nodes. The candidate will have the opportunity to participate in new technology platform definition, PPAC (power performance area cost) assessment and benchmarking, test structure design, silicon characterization and model to silicon correlation in most advanced foundry technology nodes. The candidate will work closely with other experts in the fields of CMOS process technology, device & modeling, process and device reliability, digital & analog IP design, design sign-off flow for timing and power, CAD & EDA tools, as well as chip designers from various product lines. Primary duties will include device & circuit level test structure development (from definition to layout), SPICE simulations, silicon characterization, silicon-to-simulation (S2S) correlation analysis, and interface with internal and foundry teams on S2S findings and gap resolution. Candidate must have the ability to prioritize well, communicate clearly, deliver solutions on time, and possess excellent data analysis & foundry interaction skills. The candidate expected to work across multiple facets of projects and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time. Responsibilities: Candidate will support IP and chip teams with new technology evaluation for design enablement including PPAC value proposition and silicon evaluation. Responsibilities will include test structure definition, layout & verification, extraction & simulation, silicon characterization, and analysis. Candidate will engage in collaborative team projects involving internal teams and foundry. Qualifications: This position requires an advanced degree in EE, Material Science, Physics or related field with 12+ years of industry experience after BS, or 10+ years after MS, or 7+ years after PhD. New college graduates with doctoral work in FINFET/GAA and related technologies are also encouraged to apply. Strong background in advanced CMOS technology (FEOL, MEOL, BEOL) and understanding of process-device interactions Hands-on experience with device/circuit level test structures design including layout, verification (DRC, LVS), extraction, & simulation Hands-on experience with silicon characterization (DC/AC/RF) and debug Proficient in developing automation for data analysis and correlation studies Familiarity with CMOS digital/analog circuit spice simulation including statistical simulation (Monte Carlo) analysis Familiarity with standard-cell library characterization and CAD tools Strong analytical skills and extremely detail oriented.
